versos: (groan) Romans 8:22 - "We know that the whole creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time.";;;
(noah) Genesis 6:9 - "This is the account of noah and his family. noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.";;;
(liar) Proverbs 19:22 - What a person desires is unfailing love; better to be poor than a liar.;;
(shineth) Psalm 97:4 - "His lightnings enlightened the world: the earth saw, and trembled.";;;
(gained) 1 Timothy 6:6: "But godliness with contentment is great gain.";;;
(clap) Psalm 47:1 - "clap your hands, all you nations; shout to God with cries of joy.";;;
(cutteth) Proverbs 27:17 - "Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.";;;
(depth) Romans 11:33 - "Oh, the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God How unsearchable are his judgments and how inscrutable his ways";;;
(equal) Galatians 3:28 - "There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is no male and female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus.";;;
(pearls) Matthew 7:6 - "Do not give dogs what is sacred; do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they may trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.";;;
(rubies) Proverbs 3:15 - "She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.";;;
(winds) Isaiah 41:16 - "You shall winnow them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the tempest shall scatter them.";;;
(jaws) Job 41:14 - "Who can open the doors of his face His teeth are terrible all around.";;;

(achish) 1 Samuel 28:1 - In those days the Philistines gathered their forces for war, to fight against Israel. And achish said to David, "Understand that you and your men are to go out with me in the army.";;;
(abiathar) 1 Samuel 22:20 - But one son of Ahimelech son of Ahitub
(derision) Psalm 79:12 - "And render unto our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.";;;
(shem) Genesis 5:32 - "And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat shem, Ham, and Japheth.";;;
(balance) Proverbs 11:1 - "A false balance is abomination to the Lord: but a just weight is his delight.";;;
